tossup_question: 2) MATH  When will a function, whose graph is otherwise smooth, fail to have a derivative at a point? Name three cases
tossup_answer: ANSWER: Accept any of the following: 1. A corner 2. A cusp 3. A vertical tangent/ Slope approaches zero 4. A discontinuity
bonus_question: 2) MATH  Calculate the second derivative of the following: y = 6x^2 – 10x – 5x^2
